required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on March 04, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prognosis Predicting of CRC Patients Based on Morphology and Molecular Biomaker of CTC
clinical_study.official_title: Prognosis Predicting of CRC Patients Based on Morphology and Molecular Biomaker of Circulating Tumor Cells

brief_summary.textblock: Detecting circulating tumor cells from I-IV stage colorectal cancer patients pre-and post-operatively. Analyzing the morphology and biomarkers of CTCs and builting prognosis predicting model based on the morphology and biomarkers of CTCs. Verifying the prognosis model by the survival data.

primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity of the predictive based on the number and type of circulating tumor cell
The specificity of predictive model based on the number and type of circulating tumor cell

secondary_outcome.description: Area under curve of the predictive model

arm_group.description: Training group including about 500 patients that be using to building the prognosis model
Validation group including about another 500 patients that be using to validating the prognosis model

intervention.description: detecting circulating tumor cell pre- and post operatively

study_pop.textblock: I-IV stage colorectal cancer patients with resectable lesion(s) who not receive preoperative treatment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-80 years;
Histologically proven colorectal carcinoma (TNM stage I-IV)
R0 resection is possible according to preoperative evaluation
Written informed consent for participation in the trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Primary tumor or metastases not able to be removed radically
Receiving any preoperative treatment (Including chemotherapy, radiotherapy and target therapy)
Have other malignant tumors meanwhile
Other previous malignancy within 5 years
